header.text: Every year, the Art Labyrinth Summer Festival gathers people ready to unite in search of inspiration, creativity, and mindfulness. In 2025, the festival will take place from July 10 to 13 on the picturesque banks of the Dniester River in the village of Poiana, Moldova, our most beloved and sunny place. We return here to once again create a space where art, music, and nature merge into one flow.

theme.text_1: Five Hands, One Rhythm is not just a name. It is a symbol of unity, creativity, and community. In a world full of unique individuals, only together can we create something greater. Five hands symbolize collective action, weaving various energies and directions into one harmonious and powerful force. Five hands are artists, musicians, craftsmen, dreamers, those who come to contribute their part to the big picture, creating a world without divisions.
theme.text_2: One rhythm is the heart of the festival. It is the beat that unites us all, providing space for creativity and mindfulness. It is the rhythm of life, reflected in every moment, every melody, and every movement. It is our goal — conscious creation, where every participant becomes part of something greater than themselves.

about.text_1: The Art Labyrinth Summer Festival is an annual event founded in 2008 and has since become a significant milestone in Moldova's cultural life. Every year, we choose a new location to create a unique atmosphere and connect people through art and music. But our place — Poiana, on the banks of the Dniester — has become our special corner, a place of power where nature and creativity meet.
about.text_2: We believe that the festival is not just a gathering of people. It is a space for transformation, exchange of ideas, and inspiration. At Art Labyrinth, everyone can unlock their potential, become part of a community, contribute to a common goal, and become a creator.
about.text_3: Our festival brings together different people — artists, musicians, craftsmen, volunteers, dreamers — all those ready to work in one rhythm and create something great. We invite you on a journey where every step is filled with mindfulness, every moment is harmony, and every person matters.

what.text_1: Live music and performances by local and international artists
what.text_5: Ecological initiatives and living in harmony with nature

end.text_1: Art Labyrinth is a place where the boundaries between art and life, between man and nature, between past and future disappear. It is a space for creation, inspiration, and self-expression.
end.text_2: Join us, become part of the festival, discover the rhythm of unity and creativity that will resonate in each of us.

form.header_1: Let's write the festival's story together!
form.header_2: You can ask us a question or leave a suggestion
form.name: Your name

hero.text: Art Labyrinth is not just a festival, but a space for live co-creation. There are no spectators or organizers here—everyone who attends the festival automatically becomes a participant. Participation is open to all and can take various forms: contributing to the cultural program, providing help to the festival with physical or intellectual skills, or offering financial support through donations.

rules.text_1:
Cleanliness and waste sorting
Mindful and respectful presence
Silence at dawn and night
Helping each other and the festival
Acceptance and support of differences
Initiative, openness, kindness
Creativity as a way of connection
rules.text_2:
Consumption of alcohol or substances prohibited by law
Smoking in public areas
Drunken or aggressive behavior
Cooking meat over an open fire
Harming nature: cutting branches, bushes, or trees
Lighting fires outside designated areas
Using chemicals near water sources
Littering or unsorted waste
Disturbing the peace at night
Harming any living beings

traditions.title_3: Sustainability and respect for the Earth
traditions.text_1: Art Labyrinth is more than just a festival. It’s a living space where nature, art, inner journeys, and community come together.
traditions.text_2: The festival takes place on special astronomical days—full moon or solstice. These moments enhance the energetic and symbolic depth of the experience.
traditions.text_3: We choose untouched, wild landscapes. There’s no conventional infrastructure, and that’s part of the experience—living in a tent, under the stars, by a campfire. We step away from urban rhythms, noise, and visual clutter to return to simplicity.
traditions.text_4:
The festival is built on principles of sustainable and mindful presence:
— sorting waste and leaving no trace,
— using natural materials,
— avoiding plastic,
— eating vegetarian food,
— treating all living things with care.
traditions.text_5: The festival promotes sobriety—no alcohol or psychoactive substances. This is a space of clarity, depth, and presence. Here, we meet ourselves and others authentically.
traditions.text_6: There’s no division between 'organizers' and 'spectators'—everyone contributes. All infrastructure is created by participants: stages, art installations, kitchens, workshops. You can be part of this.
traditions.text_7: The program is filled with vibrant forms: music, theater, workshops, land art, performances. The Labyrinth is also a space for personal discoveries, inspiration, and reconnecting with yourself.
traditions.text_8: The festival exists thanks to people who believe in the value of unity, art, and nature. It’s a non-profit project created through collective efforts—time, actions, and support.

guest.text: Make a contribution and learn more about ways to support the festival.

titles.slider_1: Where is the festival held? How to get there?
titles.slider_3: Will food be provided, or should I cook myself?
titles.slider_4: Can I come by car? Will there be parking?
titles.slider_5: Will there be a place to charge phones?
titles.slider_6: Will there be mobile service or internet at the site?
titles.slider_7: Do I need to buy separate tickets for concerts and workshops?
titles.slider_10: How will safety be organized at the site?
titles.slider_11: What should I do if I need medical assistance?
titles.slider_13: Can I smoke at the festival?

texts.text_1: Each year, we choose a new location for the festival. This year, it will take place in the Șoldănești District, near the village of Poiana. You can get there in several ways. Please see the 'How to Get There' section for detailed information.
texts.text_2: You should bring: comfortable clothing for activities, personal items, insect repellent, a tent, a sleeping bag or mat, eating utensils if you plan to cook for yourself, and anything else needed for a comfortable stay in nature.
texts.text_3:
The festival will have several food points catering to different preferences:
Main kitchen—simple home-cooked meals prepared over a fire.
Vedic kitchen—traditional Indian dishes without onion, garlic, or mushrooms.
Raw food kitchen—healthy food without thermal processing.
Tea house—an atmospheric space with delicious herbal teas, coffee, and natural sweets.

You can also cook independently at your camp.
texts.text_4: Yes, you can arrive by car, but vehicles cannot enter the festival grounds. There will be a paid, guarded parking area.
texts.text_5: Phones can be charged at designated spots using electricity from a generator.
texts.text_6: Internet signal may be limited due to the remote location, but mobile service will be available in some areas.
texts.text_7: No, the festival contribution includes participation in all workshops, concerts, and performances.
texts.text_8: Yes, the festival will have shower cabins and eco-toilets.
texts.text_9: Yes, clean spring water will be available at the festival.
texts.text_10: During the festival, police will be on duty, and the Art Labyrinth team will ensure order and adherence to traditions.
texts.text_11: A duty medic and first aid kit will be available near the information center.
texts.text_12: No, bringing or consuming alcohol is not in line with the festival’s traditions.
texts.text_13: Smoking is prohibited in public areas and at main festival sites.
texts.text_14: Yes, you can bring pets, but they must remain under your control.
texts.text_15: Of course! Art Labyrinth places great emphasis on families and children. A large children’s area with a varied program will be provided for kids.

org.text: Want to join the team and make a contribution? Fill out the form and join us!

titles.slider_5: When can I expect a response?
titles.slider_6: Do I need to pay a contribution?
titles.slider_10: Can I hold something outside the program?

texts.text_1: Any master, artist, musician, or teacher who wants to share knowledge, art, or inspiration. The key is alignment with the festival’s spirit: respect, sustainability, depth, and creativity.

master.text: Want to be part of the festival’s magic? Fill out the form and showcase your creativity at Art Labyrinth!
